verses.verse: Now the word<WH1697> of the LORD<WH3068> came unto Jonah<WH3124> the son<WH1121> of Amittai<WH573>, saying<WH559>,
Arise<WH6965>, go<WH3212> to Nineveh<WH5210>, that great<WH1419> city<WH5892>, and cry<WH7121> against it; for their wickedness<WH7451> is come up<WH5927> before<WH6440> me.

But Jonah<WH3124> rose up<WH6965> to flee<WH1272> unto Tarshish<WH8659> from the presence<WH6440> of the LORD<WH3068>, and went down<WH3381> to Joppa<WH3305>; and he found<WH4672> a ship<WH591> going<WH935> to Tarshish<WH8659>: so he paid<WH5414> the fare<WH7939> thereof, and went down<WH3381> into it, to go<WH935> with them unto Tarshish<WH8659> from the presence<WH6440> of the LORD<WH3068>.

¶ But the LORD<WH3068> sent out<WH2904> a great<WH1419> wind<WH7307> into the sea<WH3220>, and there was a mighty<WH1419> tempest<WH5591> in the sea<WH3220>, so that the ship<WH591> was like<WH2803> to be broken<WH7665>.

Then the mariners<WH4419> were afraid<WH3372>, and cried<WH2199> every man<WH376> unto his god<WH430>, and cast forth<WH2904> the wares<WH3627> that were in the ship<WH591> into the sea<WH3220>, to lighten<WH7043> it of them. But Jonah<WH3124> was gone down<WH3381> into the sides<WH3411> of the ship<WH5600>; and he lay<WH7901>, and was fast asleep<WH7290>.

So the shipmaster<WH7227><WH2259> came<WH7126> to him, and said<WH559> unto him, What meanest thou, O sleeper<WH7290>? arise<WH6965>, call<WH7121> upon thy God<WH430>, if so be that God<WH430> will think<WH6245> upon us, that we perish<WH6> not.

And they said<WH559> every one<WH376> to his fellow<WH7453>, Come<WH3212>, and let us cast<WH5307> lots<WH1486>, that we may know<WH3045> for whose cause<WH7945> this evil<WH7451> is upon us. So they cast<WH5307> lots<WH1486>, and the lot<WH1486> fell<WH5307> upon Jonah<WH3124>.

Then said<WH559> they unto him, Tell<WH5046> us, we pray thee, for whose cause this evil<WH7451> is upon us; What is thine occupation<WH4399>? and whence<WH370> comest<WH935> thou? what is thy country<WH776>? and of what people<WH5971> art thou?
And he said<WH559> unto them, I am an Hebrew<WH5680>; and I fear<WH3373> the LORD<WH3068>, the God<WH430> of heaven<WH8064>, which hath made<WH6213> the sea<WH3220> and the dry<WH3004> land.

Then were the men<WH582> exceedingly<WH1419><WH3374> afraid<WH3372>, and said<WH559> unto him, Why hast thou done<WH6213> this? For the men<WH582> knew<WH3045> that he fled<WH1272> from the presence<WH6440> of the LORD<WH3068>, because he had told<WH5046> them.
¶ Then said<WH559> they unto him, What shall we do<WH6213> unto thee, that the sea<WH3220> may be calm<WH8367> unto us? for the sea<WH3220> wrought<WH1980>, and was tempestuous<WH5590>.

And he said<WH559> unto them, Take me up<WH5375>, and cast me forth<WH2904> into the sea<WH3220>; so shall the sea<WH3220> be calm<WH8367> unto you: for I know<WH3045> that for my sake<WH7945> this great<WH1419> tempest<WH5591> is upon you.
Nevertheless the men<WH582> rowed hard<WH2864> to bring<WH7725> it to the land<WH3004>; but they could<WH3201> not: for the sea<WH3220> wrought<WH1980>, and was tempestuous<WH5590> against them.

Wherefore they cried<WH7121> unto the LORD<WH3068>, and said<WH559>, We beseech thee<WH577>, O LORD<WH3068>, we beseech thee, let us not perish<WH6> for this man's<WH376> life<WH5315>, and lay<WH5414> not upon us innocent<WH5355> blood<WH1818>: for thou, O LORD<WH3068>, hast done<WH6213> as it pleased<WH2654> thee.
So they took up<WH5375> Jonah<WH3124>, and cast him forth<WH2904> into the sea<WH3220>: and the sea<WH3220> ceased<WH5975> from her raging<WH2197>.
Then the men<WH582> feared<WH3372> the LORD<WH3068> exceedingly<WH1419><WH3374>, and offered<WH2076> a sacrifice<WH2077> unto the LORD<WH3068>, and made<WH5087> vows<WH5088>.

¶ Now the LORD<WH3068> had prepared<WH4487> a great<WH1419> fish<WH1709> to swallow up<WH1104> Jonah<WH3124>. And Jonah<WH3124> was in the belly<WH4578> of the fish<WH1709> three<WH7969> days<WH3117> and three<WH7969> nights<WH3915>.
